oai_dc:dc.dc:title: RANS MODELLING OF SEDIMENT TRANSPORT AND MORPHODYNAMICS OF A NOURISHED SHOREFACE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kranenborg, Joost
Werf, Jebbe van der
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A common technique employed to limit beach erosion is to nourish the coast by adding additional sediment on or close to the beach. The cross-shore redistribution of the nourished sand is an important factor for determining the efficiency of the nourishment. To help design nourishments, models that can accurately predict the cross-shore transport surfzone can be a valuable tool. In this study, we aim to demonstrate the validity of using a CFD tool for understanding the morphodynamics of a nourishment. Furthermore, we aim to investigate transport patterns responsible for redistributing sediment from the nourishments.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; sediment.29
